popt4jlib.GradientDescent
Class OneDStepQuantumOptimizer

java.lang.Object
  popt4jlib.GradientDescent.OneDStepQuantumOptimizer
public final class OneDStepQuantumOptimizer
extends java.lang.Object

the class implements a minimization method for a function alone one of its variables, using an initial starting point x0, and a quantum step-size that the variable must be constrained to take values on multiples of.

Title: popt4jlib

Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011

Company:

Version:
1.0
Author:
Ioannis T. Christou

Constructor Summary
OneDStepQuantumOptimizer()
          public no-arg no-op constructor.
 
Method Summary
 double argmin(FunctionIntf f, VectorIntf x0, java.util.HashMap fparams, int varindex, double stepquantum, double lowerbound, double upperbound, int niterbnd, int multfactor, double ftol)
          computes a local minimum of the restriction of the function f in the j-th variable, under the box-constraints lowerbound <= x_j <= upperbound, and also under the constraint that x_j = x0_j + k*stepquantum where k is an integer quantity.
 int getDir()
          if the return value is zero, it means that the optimization process did not produce a new result: the starting point was already (near-) minimal.

Method Detail

getDir

public int getDir()
if the return value is zero, it means that the optimization process did not produce a new result: the starting point was already (near-) minimal.

Returns:
int

argmin

public double argmin(FunctionIntf f,
                     VectorIntf x0,
                     java.util.HashMap fparams,
                     int varindex,
                     double stepquantum,
                     double lowerbound,
                     double upperbound,
                     int niterbnd,
                     int multfactor,
                     double ftol)
              throws OptimizerException,
                     ParallelException
computes a local minimum of the restriction of the function f in the j-th variable, under the box-constraints lowerbound <= x_j <= upperbound, and also under the constraint that x_j = x0_j + k*stepquantum where k is an integer quantity.

Parameters:
f - FunctionIntf
x0 - VectorIntf
fparams - HashMap
varindex - int
stepquantum - double
lowerbound - double
upperbound - double
niterbnd - int how many iterations to proceed in the same direction before incrementing the current step-size
multfactor - int the mult factor by which to multiply the current step-size after a number of iterations are all in the same direction
ftol - double the function tolerance below which two function evals are considered the same
Returns:
double
Throws:
OptimizerException
ParallelException
